speaker: BIRON
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: SCENE I. The same.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter HOLOFERNES, SIR NATHANIEL, and DULL

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Satis quod sufficit.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: I praise God for you, sir: your reasons at dinner

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: have been sharp and sententious; pleasant without

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: scurrility, witty without affection, audacious without

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: impudency, learned without opinion, and strange with-

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: out heresy. I did converse this quondam day with

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: a companion of the king's, who is intituled, nomi-

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: nated, or called, Don Adriano de Armado.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Novi hominem tanquam te: his humour is lofty, his

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: discourse peremptory, his tongue filed, his eye

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: ambitious, his gait majestical, and his general

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: behavior vain, ridiculous, and thrasonical. He is

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: too picked, too spruce, too affected, too odd, as it

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: were, too peregrinate, as I may call it.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: A most singular and choice epithet.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Draws out his table-book

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: He draweth out the thread of his verbosity finer

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: than the staple of his argument. I abhor such

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: fanatical phantasimes, such insociable and

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: point-devise companions; such rackers of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: orthography, as to speak dout, fine, when he should

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: say doubt; det, when he should pronounce debt,--d,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: e, b, t, not d, e, t: he clepeth a calf, cauf;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: half, hauf; neighbour vocatur nebor; neigh

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: abbreviated ne. This is abhominable,--which he

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: would call abbominable: it insinuateth me of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: insanie: anne intelligis, domine? to make frantic, lunatic.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Laus Deo, bene intelligo.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Bon, bon, fort bon, Priscian! a little scratch'd,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: 'twill serve.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Videsne quis venit?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Video, et gaudeo.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, MOTH, and COSTARD

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Chirrah!

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: To MOTH

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Quare chirrah, not sirrah?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Men of peace, well encountered.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Most military sir, salutation.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: [Aside to COSTARD]  They have been at a great feast

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: of languages, and stolen the scraps.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: O, they have lived long on the alms-basket of words.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I marvel thy master hath not eaten thee for a word;

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: for thou art not so long by the head as

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: honorificabilitudinitatibus: thou art easier

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: swallowed than a flap-dragon.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Peace! the peal begins.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: [To HOLOFERNES]  Monsieur, are you not lettered?

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Yes, yes; he teaches boys the hornbook. What is a,

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: b, spelt backward, with the horn on his head?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Ba, pueritia, with a horn added.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Ba, most silly sheep with a horn. You hear his learning.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Quis, quis, thou consonant?

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: The third of the five vowels, if you repeat them; or

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: the fifth, if I.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will repeat them,--a, e, i,--

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: The sheep: the other two concludes it,--o, u.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Now, by the salt wave of the Mediterraneum, a sweet

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: touch, a quick venue of wit! snip, snap, quick and

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: home! it rejoiceth my intellect: true wit!

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Offered by a child to an old man; which is wit-old.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: What is the figure? what is the figure?

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Horns.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Thou disputest like an infant: go, whip thy gig.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Lend me your horn to make one, and I will whip about

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: your infamy circum circa,--a gig of a cuckold's horn.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: An I had but one penny in the world, thou shouldst

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: have it to buy gingerbread: hold, there is the very

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: remuneration I had of thy master, thou halfpenny

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: purse of wit, thou pigeon-egg of discretion. O, an

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: the heavens were so pleased that thou wert but my

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: bastard, what a joyful father wouldst thou make me!

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Go to; thou hast it ad dunghill, at the fingers'

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: ends, as they say.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: O, I smell false Latin; dunghill for unguem.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Arts-man, preambulate, we will be singled from the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: barbarous. Do you not educate youth at the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: charge-house on the top of the mountain?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Or mons, the hill.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: At your sweet pleasure, for the mountain.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I do, sans question.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Sir, it is the king's most sweet pleasure and

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: affection to congratulate the princess at her

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: pavilion in the posteriors of this day, which the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: rude multitude call the afternoon.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: The posterior of the day, most generous sir, is

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: liable, congruent and measurable for the afternoon:

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: the word is well culled, chose, sweet and apt, I do

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: assure you, sir, I do assure.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Sir, the king is a noble gentleman, and my familiar,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: I do assure ye, very good friend: for what is

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: inward between us, let it pass. I do beseech thee,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: remember thy courtesy; I beseech thee, apparel thy

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: head: and among other important and most serious

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: designs, and of great import indeed, too, but let

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: that pass: for I must tell thee, it will please his

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: grace, by the world, sometime to lean upon my poor

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: shoulder, and with his royal finger, thus, dally

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: with my excrement, with my mustachio; but, sweet

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: heart, let that pass. By the world, I recount no

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: fable: some certain special honours it pleaseth his

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: greatness to impart to Armado, a soldier, a man of

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: travel, that hath seen the world; but let that pass.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The very all of all is,--but, sweet heart, I do

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: implore secrecy,--that the king would have me

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: present the princess, sweet chuck, with some

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: delightful ostentation, or show, or pageant, or

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: antique, or firework. Now, understanding that the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: curate and your sweet self are good at such

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: eruptions and sudden breaking out of mirth, as it

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: were, I have acquainted you withal, to the end to

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: crave your assistance.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Sir, you shall present before her the Nine Worthies.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Sir, as concerning some entertainment of time, some

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: show in the posterior of this day, to be rendered by

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: our assistants, at the king's command, and this most

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: gallant, illustrate, and learned gentleman, before

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: the princess; I say none so fit as to present the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Nine Worthies.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Where will you find men worthy enough to present them?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Joshua, yourself; myself and this gallant gentleman,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Judas Maccabaeus; this swain, because of his great

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: limb or joint, shall pass Pompey the Great; the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: page, Hercules,--

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Pardon, sir; error: he is not quantity enough for

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: that Worthy's thumb: he is not so big as the end of his club.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Shall I have audience? he shall present Hercules in

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: minority: his enter and exit shall be strangling a

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: snake; and I will have an apology for that purpose.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: An excellent device! so, if any of the audience

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: hiss, you may cry 'Well done, Hercules! now thou

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: crushest the snake!' that is the way to make an

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: offence gracious, though few have the grace to do it.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: For the rest of the Worthies?--

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will play three myself.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Thrice-worthy gentleman!

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Shall I tell you a thing?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: We attend.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: We will have, if this fadge not, an antique. I

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: beseech you, follow.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Via, goodman Dull! thou hast spoken no word all this while.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: Nor understood none neither, sir.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Allons! we will employ thee.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: I'll make one in a dance, or so; or I will play

speaker: DULL
text_entry: On the tabour to the Worthies, and let them dance the hay.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Most dull, honest Dull! To our sport, away!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: LOVE'S LABOURS LOST
